medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive dull epigastric abdominal pain for 2 weeks.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 weeks ago, progressively worsening. Pain radiates bilaterally and is not associated with back pain. Aggravated by poor oral intake but food does not seem to worsen pain. Associated symptoms include nausea without vomiting and fatigue.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hepatitis C cirrhosis complicated by GI bleed and hepatic encephalopathy, status post living related liver transplant and TIPS. Hypertension, coronary artery disease with a history of myocardial infarction, and tonsillectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for coronary thrombosis in his father.
medical_history.social_history: Denies alcohol use, last drink unspecified. No recent travel or diet changes.
